is there something way, that search in a **"example.txt"** file for a string **"example"** ? I tried Fileread and Fileseek but its not successful yet... later i'd like to write thats why append __FileOpen $4 "$SYSDIR\\drivers\\etc\\hosts" a__
FileSeek $4 0 SET
FileRead $4 $1
${If} $1 != "example"
Strcmp $4 "example" end 0
StrCmp $0 1 0 end

is there something way, that search in a `example.txt` file for a string `example`? 

I tried `Fileread` and `Fileseek` but it is not successful yet... later i'd like to write thats why append

    FileOpen $4 "$SYSDIR\\drivers\\etc\\hosts" a
    FileSeek $4 0 SET
    FileRead $4 $1

    Strcmp $1 "example" end 0
 

Or can i walk the file with `While`? But when ends the file?

is there something way, that search in a `example.txt` file for a string `example`? I tried `Fileread` and `Fileseek` but it is not successful yet... later i'd like to write thats why append FileOpen $4 "$SYSDIR\\drivers\\etc\\hosts" a FileSeek $4 0 SET FileRead $4 $1 ${If} $1 != "example" Strcmp $1 "example" end 0 Or can i walk the file with `While`? But when ends the file? ##UPDATED## FileOpen $0 "$SYSDIR\\drivers\\etc\\hosts" a ;open file for append if exist (read and write)

loop:

FileRead $0 $2
IfErrors done
Messagebox MB_OK "$2"

StrCmp $2 "30.0.0.0 dispatcher" 0 loop
MessageBox MB_OK "30.0.0.0 dispatcher found"
FileSeek $2 0 END ;file positioning to the END->end of the file
FileWrite $2 "$\\r$\\n" ; new line
FileWrite $2 "30.0.0.0 dispatcher" ;write ip and dispatcher
FileWrite $2 "$\\r$\\n" ; extra line
done: FileClose $0 ;close file Quit Now its go the whole file but with strcmp nothing doing. Somebody please help.

is there something way, that search in a `example.txt` file for a string `example`? I tried `Fileread` and `Fileseek` but it is not successful yet... later i'd like to write thats why append FileOpen $4 "$SYSDIR\\drivers\\etc\\hosts" a FileSeek $4 0 SET FileRead $4 $1 ${If} $1 != "example" Strcmp $1 "example" end 0 Or can i walk the file with `While`? But when ends the file? ##UPDATED## !define IP_AND_DISPATCHER "30.0.0.0 dispatcher" FileOpen $0 "$SYSDIR\\drivers\\etc\\hosts" a
loop:

FileRead $0 $2
IfErrors done
Messagebox MB_OK "$2"
StrCmp $2 "${IP_AND_DISPATCHER}$\\r$\\n" 0 loop
MessageBox MB_OK "$${IP_AND_DISPATCHER} found"
FileClose $2 ;close file
Quit
done:

FileSeek $0 0 END
FileWrite $0 "$\\r$\\n" ; new line
FileWrite $0 "${IP_AND_DISPATCHER}" ;write ip and dispatcher
FileWrite $0 "$\\r$\\n" ; extra line
FileClose $0 ;close file
Now its work, but is there a way not to write the 30.0.0.0 dispatcher so not the line...just for example "dispatcher" word?
